comment_text: Based on your YOE that seems alright.. but you may have a little room for negotiation especially given your location and current base. The stock is indeed a valuable addition to TC I would not write it off in your decision-making.Regarding your questions about working at Doximity, it's pretty good and I would generally recommend. Great remote-first company that shows its appreciation of employees through all kinds of little ways. Strong leadership imo. And when covid finishes winding down the quarterly offsites are a great time / opportunity to travel. But it is what you make of it, you have a large responsibility in the quality of your experience in a remote setting.
Any negative reviews are instantly buried by a bunch of 5-star reviews written by HR
